low.question: What is the standard number of letters in the modern English alphabet?
Which numeral system uses digits 0 through 9?
Which ancient script is widely considered the ancestor of many modern alphabets?
How many bits does the original ASCII code use to represent characters?
Which number system uses only two symbols, typically 0 and 1?
Which writing system arranges signs to represent individual spoken sounds (consonants and vowels)?
Which numeral system uses digits 0–9 and letters A–F to represent values?
Who invented Braille, the tactile writing system for the blind?
Which script is commonly referred to as an abjad, primarily representing consonants?
Which set of numerals is commonly called 'Hindu-Arabic numerals'?
options: I, V, X, L, C, D, M

low.question: What is the common English name for the base-60 number system?

Which code used long and short signals to encode letters and numbers?
Which ancient numeral system famously lacks a symbol for zero?

Which alphabet introduced the letter forms that evolved into the modern Latin alphabet?
Which numeral system did ancient Mesopotamians use that influences modern time measurement?
Which script was developed by Sequoyah for the Cherokee language?
What is the primary purpose of the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)?
Which character set standard extends ASCII and assigns code points to virtually all scripts?
What is a common name for the base-8 numeral system?
Which script is an abugida where consonant letters carry an inherent vowel?
Which medieval mathematician introduced Hindu-Arabic numerals to Europe in Liber Abaci?
Which system marks thousands in Roman numerals using an overline?
Which alphabet is written from right to left and contains 22 letters?
Which modern script was created in the 15th century to write Korean?
Which numeric prefix indicates a base of twelve in numeral systems?
Which system encodes characters as numerical code points like U+0041 for 'A'?
Which early alphabetic symbol meaning 'ox' developed into the letter 'A'?

medium.question: Which writing system represents consonants only and requires vowels be inferred?
Who popularized binary arithmetic in the West with an influential 1703 paper?
Which ancient culture developed the positional base-60 number system?
Which script classifies vowels as diacritics attached to consonant symbols?
Which numeric notation did Europeans largely adopt after Fibonacci's book Liber Abaci?
Which early writing system for Greek was a syllabary deciphered in the 20th century?
Which modern standard encodes over a million characters across multiple planes?
What is the canonical name for the Unicode block containing basic Latin letters?
Which numeral system did the Maya develop independently including a zero symbol?

Which property describes Roman numerals compared to positional systems?
Which code ensures only one bit changes between successive values in sequence?
Which script influenced the development of the modern Cyrillic alphabet?
Which numeric representation stores decimal digits in binary-coded form?
Which system uses base-16 and is common in computing for color codes and memory addresses?
Which inventory of letters forms the International Morse alphabet for telegraphy?
Which alphabetic order tradition places letters in the same sequence as Phoenician origin?
Which ancient numeral system used wedge-shaped marks pressed into clay tablets?
Which script is known for its distinctive syllabic signs on inscriptions at Ugarit?
Which alphabet type groups letters by shared visual features, like Korean Hangul?
Which organization oversees the Unicode Standard and its code charts?
Which numeral system name literally means 'counting by twelves'?

Which early numeric artifact shows a positional sexagesimal system on clay tablets?
Which script uses diacritics called harakat to represent short vowels in Arabic?

hard.question: Which Phoenician letter name originally meant 'ox' and morphed into Greek Alpha and Latin A?

Which 19th-century scholar deciphered Linear B in 1952 using comparative linguistic methods?
Which notation did Brahmagupta formalize with rules for zero in the 7th century CE?

Which digital text encoding form is a variable-length encoding of Unicode using one to four bytes?
Which specialized numeral system uses digits −1, 0, and +1 often represented as T, 0, 1?

Which medieval manuscript tradition created the Carolingian minuscule influencing modern lowercase?
Which numeric representation method stores negative integers by inverting bits and adding one?

Which alphabetic script reformer created Armenian letters roughly in the year 405 CE?
Which ancient culture applied acrophony to name letters after everyday objects like 'house' and 'ox'?
